text: Deana Carter (born January 4, 1966) is an American country music singer. She began her career in 1994. In 1996, she had successful singles including Strawberry Wine and How Do I Get There. Carter was born in Nashville, Tennessee. ==Awards and nominations== Year Association Category Result 1997 39th Grammy Awards Best Country Female Vocal Performance — "Strawberry Wine" Country Music Association Awards Single of the Year — "Strawberry Wine" Female Vocalist of the Year Horizon Award Album of the Year — Did I Shave My Legs for This? Music Video of the Year — "Strawberry Wine" 1998 Academy of Country Music Awards Single Record of the Year — "Strawberry Wine" Song of the Year — "Strawberry Wine" Top New Female Vocalist Country Music Association Awards Music Video of the Year — "Did I Shave My Legs for This?" 40th Grammy Awards Best Country Female Vocal Performance — "Did I Shave My Legs for This?" 2011 Country Music Association Awards Song of the Year — "You and Tequila" 2012 54th Grammy Awards Best Country Song — "You and Tequila" ==References== Category:Country musicians from Tennessee Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:Musicians from Nashville, Tennessee Category:Singers from Nashville, Tennessee
title: Deana Carter
